action.primary: Tonifies and stabilizes the Kidneys and astringes Jing and urine

indications: Urinary frequency, enuresis, impotence, spermatorrhea, premature ejaculation or wet dreams due to Kidney Yang Deficiency
Poor vision, soreness of the lower back and impotence due to Liver and Kidney Deficiency

contraindications: Use caution for those with Kidney Yin Deficiency patterns with Heat signs.
Contraindicated for those with burning urination due to Damp-Heat in the Lower Jiao.
Contraindicated for those with frequent erections.

useCases: Urinary incontinence and frequency due to Lower Jiao Deficiency.
Impotence and spermatorrhea due to Kidney Deficiency.
Impotence or infertility due to Kidney Yang Deficiency.
Low back pain and coldness in the lower extremities due to Kidney Deficiency.
Lower back pain and impotence due to Kidney Deficiency.
Poor vision due to Kidney Deficiency.
Spermatorrhea, nocturnal emission premature ejaculation and impotence.

notes: This herb augments Qi, lightens the body, restores what has been severed, strengthens the Yin and Yang, makes the skin glossy, quiets and the harmonizes Yin and Yang organs, warms the Middle, augments strength, remedies injury from consumption, tonifies the Liver, brightens the eyes and keeps the hair from turning white.
Some sources say that this herb generates seminal fluid and nourishes true Yin by astringing Yin Qi.

Both Fu Pen Zi and Ootheca Mantidis #{SangPiaoXiao} Sang Piao Xiao tonify, restrain and constrain and treat Kidney Deficiency leading to enuresis, urinary frequency spermatorrhea and impotence. Fu Pen Zi is sweet and neutral and more strongly enriches the true Yin. Sang Piao Xiao is salty and more strongly reinforces the Yang.
